reviewText: I'm a machine learning person, and this book provides pretty thorough state-of-art and up-to-date (relatively well) summary of statistical methods being used in lots of pattern classification fields. One thing that does not exist in the book is generative models, although this book is the best of the kind that describes discriminitive models.
title: The Elements of Statistical Learning: Data Mining, Inference, and Prediction (Springer Series in Statistics)
